meanings.sent1: The cheetah was overtaking the gazelle in the race.
meanings.sent2: The car was overtaking the truck on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise joked that it was overtaking the hare in the speed department.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was overtaking her fear as she sprinted towards the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The river's current was overtaking the boat, pushing it downstream rapidly.

meanings.sent1: The student was overtaking his classmates in the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: The cyclist was overtaking the other riders in the race.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was overtaking the birds in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: His new invention was overtaking the competition in the market.
meanings.sent5: The young sapling was overtaking the older trees in height growth.

meanings.definition: To surpass in development or achievement
meanings.sent1: Her skills were overtaking those of her peers in the dance class.
meanings.sent2: The technology company was overtaking its rivals in innovation.
meanings.sent3: The little seedling was overtaking the other plants in the garden.
meanings.sent4: His dedication was overtaking his previous records in the sport.
meanings.sent5: The artist's new painting was overtaking her previous works in popularity.
